description: Monitor executed commands and arguments for commands that can be used to disable logging. For example, [Wevtutil](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0645), auditpol, sc stop EventLog, and offensive tooling (such as [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) and Invoke-Phant0m) may be used to clear logs.(Citation: def_ev_win_event_logging)(Citation: evt_log_tampering)

external_references.description: Chandel, R. (2021, April 22). Defense Evasion: Windows Event Logging (T1562.002). Retrieved September 14, 2021.
svch0st. (2020, September 30). Event Log Tampering Part 1: Disrupting the EventLog Service. Retrieved September 14, 2021.
